item.title: Net Eurozone Government-Bond Issuance Is Set to Rise in September
item.description: Gross government-bond issuance in the eurozone is set to rise to €100 billion in September from €84 billion in August, while redemptions will fall to €47 billion from €61 billion, ING said.

item.title: Chevron LNG Workers in Australia Plan Two-Week Strike
item.description: Workers at two giant natural-gas operations run by Chevron in Australia are planning a two-week strike starting Sept. 14, said Offshore Alliance, a partnership between two local unions.

item.title: Metals Fall Amid Strong Dollar
item.description: Metals prices were falling with a strong dollar and worries about more interest-rate hikes from the Fed spooking investors.

item.title: Euro Falls Due to Stronger Dollar; Focus Will Soon Turn to Next ECB Meeting
item.description: The euro fell to a 12-week low against a broadly firmer dollar but Tuesday’s data calendar gives little hope for new direction for the single currency, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: China Shares End Lower as Sluggish Growth Prospects Weigh
item.description: Chinese shares ended lower on fading optimism over Beijing’s recent supportive measures.

item.title: Biocredits Could Help Save the Earth. But a Market Is Some Way Off.
item.description: More money is needed to protect the earth’s biodiversity, but there are hurdles in the way of a trading system that could raise the funds needed.

item.title: Ukraine's Secret Boat Raids Are Exposing Cracks in Russia's Southern Front
item.description: Small, secret boat raids along the Dnipro River are playing an outsized role in Ukraine’s counteroffensive strategy—revealing cracks in Russia’s southern front and creating tough choices for Russian commanders.

item.title: UK Retail Sales Rise as Consumer Confidence Improves
item.description: Retail sales in the U.K. increased by 4.1% in the four weeks to Aug. 26, but growth is expected to fall in the coming months as inflation eases.

item.title: Aussie Bond Bounce May Not Signal Dovish RBA Statement
item.description: Despite a relatively featureless statement from Australia’s central bank when keeping the cash rate unchanged at 4.10%, RBC observed a small bounce in 3-year bond futures and some bank bill futures straight after its release.

item.title: China's Country Garden Makes Overdue Dollar-Bond Payments, Narrowly Avoiding Default
item.description: The property giant paid $22.5 million in coupons to international bondholders just before the end of a 30-day grace period.

item.title: RBA Stands Pat for a Third Month
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia left its official cash rate unchanged, but remained cautious about the outlook, saying that further interest-rate increases remain a possibility as inflation remains too high.

item.title: Russia-Led Theatrics Take Center Stage at U.N.
item.description: Moscow’s invitees to the Security Council’s discussions of the war in Ukraine have included the Pink Floyd co-founder Roger Waters.

item.title: Yes, There Is a Bull Case for Investing in China
item.description: Contrarians might have passed over China because of the constant flow of bad news. But the point of being a contrarian is to venture to places that others shun.

item.title: Gabon President Becomes Latest Western Military Ally to Fall in Coup
item.description: The Gabonese officers’ announcement that President Ali Bongo had been detained comes five weeks after the ouster of Niger’s Western-supported leader.

item.title: China's Xi will skip the G-20 meeting in New Delhi, instead sending his top deputy to the summit in what is likely to be seen as a snub of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
item.description: China’s Xi will skip the G-20 meeting in New Delhi, instead sending his top deputy to the summit in what is likely to be seen as a snub of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

item.title: Iran significantly slowed the pace at which it is accumulating near-weapons-grade enriched uranium in recent months, the IAEA reported.
item.description: Iran significantly slowed the pace at which it is accumulating near-weapons-grade enriched uranium in recent months, the IAEA reported.

item.title: Gabon's new military leader was sworn in as head of state less than a week after ousting President Ali Bongo Ondimba.
item.description: Gabon‘s new military leader was sworn in as head of state less than a week after ousting President Ali Bongo Ondimba.

item.title: North Korea's Kim is expected to travel to Russia soon to meet with Putin, U.S. officials said, the latest sign that negotiations are accelerating over ammunition Moscow is seeking for its war in Ukraine.
item.description: North Korea’s Kim is expected to travel to Russia soon to meet with Putin, U.S. officials said, the latest sign that negotiations are accelerating over ammunition Moscow is seeking for its war in Ukraine.

item.title: Putin said Russia won't rejoin a deal enabling Ukrainian grain to be shipped globally until the West meets its demands to facilitate Russian agricultural exports.
item.description: Putin said Russia won’t rejoin a deal enabling Ukrainian grain to be shipped globally until the West meets its demands to facilitate Russian agricultural exports.

item.title: Voters overwhelmingly think Biden is too old to run for re-election and give him low marks for handling the economy and other issues important to their vote, according to a new Wall Street Journal poll that offers a stark warning to the 80-year-old incumbent ahead of the 2024 contest.
item.description: Voters overwhelmingly think Biden is too old to run for re-election and give him low marks for handling the economy and other issues important to their vote, according to a new Wall Street Journal poll that offers a stark warning to the 80-year-old incumbent ahead of the 2024 contest.
